xxhash32.h
1 // //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2 // xxhash32.h
3 // Copyright (c) 2016 Stephan Brumme. All rights reserved.
4 // see http://create.stephan-brumme.com/disclaimer.html
5 //
6 
7 #pragma once
8 #include <stdint.h> // for uint32_t and uint64_t
9 
11 
24 class XXHash32
25 {
26 public:
28 
29  explicit XXHash32(uint32_t seed)
30  {
31  state[0] = seed + Prime1 + Prime2;
32  state[1] = seed + Prime2;
33  state[2] = seed;
34  state[3] = seed - Prime1;
35  bufferSize = 0;
36  totalLength = 0;
37  }
38 
40 
43  bool add(const void* input, uint64_t length)
44  {
45  // no data ?
46  if (!input || length == 0)
47  return false;
48 
49  totalLength += length;
50  // byte-wise access
51  const unsigned char* data = (const unsigned char*)input;
52 
53  // unprocessed old data plus new data still fit in temporary buffer ?
54  if (bufferSize + length < MaxBufferSize)
55  {
56  // just add new data
57  while (length-- > 0)
58  buffer[bufferSize++] = *data++;
59  return true;
60  }
61 
62  // point beyond last byte
63  const unsigned char* stop = data + length;
64  const unsigned char* stopBlock = stop - MaxBufferSize;
65 
66  // some data left from previous update ?
67  if (bufferSize > 0)
68  {
69  // make sure temporary buffer is full (16 bytes)
70  while (bufferSize < MaxBufferSize)
71  buffer[bufferSize++] = *data++;
72 
73  // process these 16 bytes (4x4)
74  process(buffer, state[0], state[1], state[2], state[3]);
75  }
76 
77  // copying state to local variables helps optimizer A LOT
78  uint32_t s0 = state[0], s1 = state[1], s2 = state[2], s3 = state[3];
79  // 16 bytes at once
80  while (data <= stopBlock)
81  {
82  // local variables s0..s3 instead of state[0]..state[3] are much faster
83  process(data, s0, s1, s2, s3);
84  data += 16;
85  }
86  // copy back
87  state[0] = s0; state[1] = s1; state[2] = s2; state[3] = s3;
88 
89  // copy remainder to temporary buffer
90  bufferSize = stop - data;
91  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < bufferSize; i++)
92  buffer[i] = data[i];
93 
94  // done
95  return true;
96  }
97 
99 
100  uint32_t hash() const
101  {
102  uint32_t result = (uint32_t)totalLength;
103 
104  // fold 128 bit state into one single 32 bit value
105  if (totalLength >= MaxBufferSize) {
106  result += rotateLeft(state[0], 1) +
107  rotateLeft(state[1], 7) +
108  rotateLeft(state[2], 12) +
109  rotateLeft(state[3], 18);
110  }
111  else {
112  // internal state wasn't set in add(), therefore original seed is still stored in state2
113  result += state[2] + Prime5;
114  }
115 
116  // process remaining bytes in temporary buffer
117  const unsigned char* data = buffer;
118  // point beyond last byte
119  const unsigned char* stop = data + bufferSize;
120 
121  // at least 4 bytes left ? => eat 4 bytes per step
122  for (; data + 4 <= stop; data += 4)
123  result = rotateLeft(result + *(uint32_t*)data * Prime3, 17) * Prime4;
124 
125  // take care of remaining 0..3 bytes, eat 1 byte per step
126  while (data != stop) {
127  result = rotateLeft(result + (*data++) * Prime5, 11) * Prime1;
128  }
129 
130  // mix bits
131  result ^= result >> 15;
132  result *= Prime2;
133  result ^= result >> 13;
134  result *= Prime3;
135  result ^= result >> 16;
136  return result;
137  }
138 
140 
144  static uint32_t hash(const void* input, uint64_t length, uint32_t seed)
145  {
146  XXHash32 hasher(seed);
147  hasher.add(input, length);
148  return hasher.hash();
149  }
150 
151 private:
153  static const uint32_t Prime1 = 2654435761U;
154  static const uint32_t Prime2 = 2246822519U;
155  static const uint32_t Prime3 = 3266489917U;
156  static const uint32_t Prime4 = 668265263U;
157  static const uint32_t Prime5 = 374761393U;
158 
160  static const uint32_t MaxBufferSize = 15+1;
161 
162  // internal state and temporary buffer
163  uint32_t state[4]; // state[2] == seed if totalLength < MaxBufferSize
164  unsigned char buffer[MaxBufferSize];
165  unsigned int bufferSize;
166  uint64_t totalLength;
167 
169  static inline uint32_t rotateLeft(uint32_t x, unsigned char bits)
170  {
171  return (x << bits) | (x >> (32 - bits));
172  }
173 
175  static inline void process(const void* data, uint32_t& state0, uint32_t& state1, uint32_t& state2, uint32_t& state3)
176  {
177  const uint32_t* block = (const uint32_t*) data;
178  state0 = rotateLeft(state0 + block[0] * Prime2, 13) * Prime1;
179  state1 = rotateLeft(state1 + block[1] * Prime2, 13) * Prime1;
180  state2 = rotateLeft(state2 + block[2] * Prime2, 13) * Prime1;
181  state3 = rotateLeft(state3 + block[3] * Prime2, 13) * Prime1;
182  }
183 };

uint32_t hash() const
get current hash

XXHash32
XXHash (32 bit), based on Yann Collet's descriptions, see http://cyan4973.github.io/xxHash/.

add a chunk of bytes

XXHash32(uint32_t seed)
create new XXHash (32 bit)

XXHash32::hash
static uint32_t hash(const void *input, uint64_t length, uint32_t seed)
combine constructor, add() and hash() in one static function (C style)
